fullProgramDescription: The Political Science major is designed to provide students with a broad understanding of the discipline, as well as the opportunity to focus on specific areas of interest. The Political Theory subfield focuses on the study of political thought and its application to contemporary issues.
shortProgramDescription: The Political Science/Political Theory B.A. provides a comprehensive understanding of political systems, institutions, and theories, preparing students for careers in government, law, and public policy.
classHighlights: The major requires a set of core courses that introduce students to the discipline, including POLI27: Introduction to Political Theory, POLI28: Comparative Politics, and POLI30: Introduction to American Politics.

Students take additional courses in political theory, including POLI127: Advanced Topics in Political Theory, and other upper-division courses that explore the history of political thought, contemporary theoretical debates, and the application of theory to real-world issues.

Electives allow students to explore related fields, such as comparative politics, international relations, and public policy, and to develop a deeper understanding of the complex relationships between politics, society, and economy.
Upper-division courses emphasize critical thinking, research, and writing skills, preparing students for advanced study or careers in fields related to politics and governance.
learningOutcomes: Demonstrate a broad understanding of the discipline of political science
Analyze and interpret complex political phenomena
Apply theoretical frameworks to real-world issues
Develop critical thinking, research, and writing skills
Understand the historical and contemporary contexts of political thought and institutions
creditRequirements: 48 upper-division units in political science, plus12 lower-division units; total180 quarter units
additionalInformation: The department recommends that students consult with advisors to plan their course sequence and electives. The major is administered by the Department of Political Science, which is located in the Division of Social Sciences.
